text: Assertion: When charges are shared between any two bodies, no charge is really lost, but some loss of energy does occur. Reason: Energy disappear in the form of heat. Sparking, etc.

options.a: Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is not the correct explanation of (A)
options.b: (A) is correct but (R) is not correct
options.c: (A) is not correct but (R) is correct
options.d: Both (A) and (R) are correct and (R) is the correct explanation of (A)

hint: Charge is always conserved but energy is lost in the terms of heat.  But it does not mean energy conservation is violated.
